com.devwebsphere.wxssearch
Class IndexManager<A,RK>

java.lang.Object
  com.devwebsphere.wxssearch.IndexManager<A,RK>

public class IndexManager<A,RK>
extends java.lang.Object

This is a client class for managing full search indexes. The application should make one Index for each attribute that needs to be searchable.

Constructor Summary

Constructor Detail

IndexManager

public IndexManager(WXSUtils utils,
                    java.lang.Class<A> indexClass)
Create a WXSUtils and provide this. This is used for all bulk operations. The indexClass should be the Map value being indexed and should have annotations to indicate which fields are being indexed.

Parameters:
utils - The client connection wrapped with utils
indexClass - The value class to 'index'
Method Detail

getIndex

public Index<A,RK> getIndex(java.lang.String indexName)
This returns and initializes the index for a specific attribute. The index name should be a combination of the object name and attribute name. The object map being indexed should have keys of type RK.

Parameters:
indexName - The name of this index.
Returns:
An index object

searchMultipleIndexes

public SearchResult<RK> searchMultipleIndexes(A criteria,
                                              boolean isAND)
This method searches across multiple indexes and combines the answers. Create the business object and only initialize the attributes you want to actually use in the query. You can AND or OR all these attributes.

Parameters:
criteria - A business object with only attributes in the query set. Others must be null
isAND - TRUE if results are to be ANDed otherwise the results are ORed
Returns:
The list of keys for the matching entries

convertToKeys

public static java.util.List<ByteArrayKey> convertToKeys(java.util.Collection<byte[]> keys)

indexAll

public void indexAll(java.util.Map<RK,A> entries)
This takes a Map of keys and business object entries and indexes all indexes attributes in one method call.

Parameters:
entries -

getDigest

public static java.security.MessageDigest getDigest()
This just returns the digest we will use to generate hashes. SHA and MD5 are very good hash functions. MD5 is about 40% faster than SHA so we'll use MD5

Returns:

getIndexClass

public final java.lang.Class<A> getIndexClass()
